paper_abstract: It is known that there is a constant c > 0 such that for every sequence x(1), x(2),... in [0, 1) we have for the star discrepancy D-N(*) of the first N elements of the sequence that NDN* >= c . log N holds for infinitely many N. Let c* be the supremum of all such c with this property. We show c* > 0.0646363, thereby improving the until now known estimates. (C) 2014 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On the star discrepancy of sequences in the unit interval
